data.title: Problems importing csv file into mySQL via PHPAdmin
data.meta_description:

data.text:
Hi there. I have a problem importing a csv file which contains roughtly 100,000 records (approximately 34MB) into my database via the Import function in phpMyAdmin.

I have changed the max_execution_time value from 30 to 600 (seconds) in the php.ini file in the C:\xampp\php directory.

I’ve also changed the $cfg[‘ExecTimeLimit’] value from 300 to 0 in the config.default.php in the C:\xampp\phpMyAdmin\libraries directory.

I’ve also tried reducign the file down to 25,000 records but still get errors:

Warning in .\libraries\dbi\DBIMysqli.class.php#258

mysqli_query(): MySQL server has gone away

Warning in .\libraries\dbi\DBIMysqli.class.php#258 mysqli_query(): MySQL server has gone away Backtrace .\libraries\dbi\DBIMysqli.class.php#258: mysqli_query( object, string , integer 0, ) .\libraries\DatabaseInterface.class.php#183: PMA_DBI_Mysqli->realQuery( string , object, integer 0, ) .\libraries\import.lib.php#170: PMA_DatabaseInterface->tryQuery(string ) .\libraries\plugins\import\ImportCsv.class.php#622: PMA_importRunQuery() .\import.php#599: ImportCsv->doImport(array)

Can anyone please help?

(Ideally, I need to automate the import so that it runs on a daily basis at a specific time but, for now, I’m just trying to get the data imported. I’d also be happy with importing it via PHP by clicking a button on a web page)

The phpMyAdmin import routine is limited in some way. I can’t remember what the limiting factor is though. I suspect the 34Mb file is over the limit for file upload size though. This limit is likely set under the xampp config somewhere.

Does the import need to be done through a web interface? Have a look at MySQL Workbench ( https://www.mysql.com/products/workbench/ ) or even MySQL command-line routines (I believe phpMyAdmin simply calls the command-line routines internally!)
